item.title: - Perturbation Analysis using the Hellmann-Feynman Theorem
item.description: Introduction # We consider the Hamiltonian: $$H = H_0 + V_\gamma, \quad V_\gamma = \frac{\gamma}{r^2}$$ where the unperturbed Hamiltonian is given by $$H_0 = \frac{p_r^2}{2m} + \frac{\hbar^2 l(l+1)}{2m r^2} - \frac{Z e^2}{r}.$$ The eigenvalues of the perturbed and unperturbed Hamiltonians are denoted as $E_n(\gamma)$ and $E_n^{(0)}$, respectively.
